pull.title: doc: Remove fee delta TODO from txmempool.cpp
pull.body: This refactor request was added in commit eb306664e786ae43d539fde66f0fbe2a3e89d910, though it didn't explain why the refactor is needed and what the goal is. Given that this wasn't touched for more than 5 years, it doesn't seem critical. Generally, non-trivial `TODO`s make more sense as GitHub issues, so that they can be discussed and triaged more easily.

verification.payload:

parent 9e3f7dcaa2f89efff48d299132f4998bf701c264

doc: Remove fee delta TODO from txmempool.cpp

events.message: doc: Remove fee delta TODO from txmempool.cpp

events.body:
I am suspecting that this refactor request might have been a feature request on how prioritization should be handled for packages? Though, in that case it also makes more sense to discuss in an issue.

ping @sdaftuar in case I am missing something obvious.

Code review ACK fa32cc0682a0aa3420e6a11031721fcb6c50fa44

> Generally, non-trivial TODOs make more sense as GitHub issues, so that they can be discussed and triaged more easily.

Just going to go ahead and merge this. I fully agree with the OP. Any next steps can be done whether there's a TODO comment in the source code or not.

issue.title: backport:  bitcoin#23416,#18997,#18996, partial #27483 (TODO cleanup)
issue.body:
## Issue being fixed or feature implemented
V20 release preparation - TODO review

## What was done?
Bitcoin backports:
 - partial bitcoin#27483
 - bitcoin#23416
 - bitcoin#18997
 - bitcoin#18996


## How Has This Been Tested?
Run unit/functional tests

## Breaking Changes
n/a

## Checklist:
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have added or updated relevant unit/integration/functional/e2e tests
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] I have assigned this pull request to a milestone

comments.body: Don't have much background on what was intended, but I interpret this TODO to be "move these 2 lines up before the `insert` call, and delete the `mapTx.modify()` call below?
Yes, it is possible to fix it in that way, see commit fa300f581fe6cd4b37c7cefb191722ff970e0116. Are you suggesting I open a pull with that?
Yeah I think it's better, regardless of whether that's what the todo is referring to
Should we just convert this PR into the suggested fix?
